page.shortlink: api client api a5 chart definition line object
page.description: The definition of a chart line.

property.name: type
property.description: The type of line to draw. Values can be "solid", "dotted", "dashed", "long-dashed", "dot-dashed" and "dot-long-dashed". All values except "solid" can have a suffix of a "+" followed by a number to increase the spacing.

property.name: color
property.description: The color of the line. A value of "default" (the default), will use the default color for the element from the palette. If a gradient is being used, then an array of two colors can be passed in to explicitly set the start and end color. If a single color is passed in then the gradient colors will automatically be created with that color as the midpoint. A value of "none" or "transparent" will result in the line not being drawn. A function can be used to dynamically calculate the color (see *[link:A5.chart Render Data Object]*).

property.name: gradient
property.description: The name of the gradient to use. A value of "none" (the default), will not use a gradient. See *[link:A5.chart.u.style.defaults.gradients]*. A function can be used to dynamically calculate the gradient (see *[link:A5.chart Render Data Object]*).

property.name: width
property.description: The width of the line. A function can be used to dynamically calculate the width (see *[link:A5.chart Render Data Object]*).

property.name: opacity
property.description: The opacity of the line from 0 (transparent) to 1 (solid). A function can be used to dynamically calculate the opacity (see *[link:A5.chart Render Data Object]*).
